alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 1:24PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. No flooding occurs. This is about 2600 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:55 AM PDT Friday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.4 feet Sunday evening. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM PDT.
